newsitem.title: FRANCE: French stocks close higher on results, U.S. data.
newsitem.headline: French stocks close higher on results, U.S. data.

text.p: French stocks finished higher on Friday, buoyed by helpful U.S. data and better-than-expected corporate results, traders said.
"If the results keep coming out this way, the market could get a real bounce," one trader said after a string of companies reported big profit gains for the first half.
The blue-chip CAC-40 index closed up 8.52 points, or 0.43 percent, at 2,004.75, while the CAC-40 September futures contract climbed 22 points to 2,016.
For the week, the CAC index was up 1.73 percent.
The bourse was swept up with other European markets after the U.S. bond market recovered from an initial fall on a drop in the U.S. unemployment rate to a seven-year low of 5.1 percent.
Relief was provided by the number of jobs created during the month which fell in line with analysts' estimates.

Shares in car parts manufacturer Valeo rose 17.20 francs to 279.70. Several brokers raised their rating on the stock after the company reported a 31 percent jump in its pre-exceptional first-half profit on Thursday.
